abstract.text: Returns a human readable string for a status code.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to the secondary status result that provides additional information in case of failure.
The status to be examined.
The kind of status to be examined. Set to
for a GSS status code, or to
for a mechanism status code.
The mechanism for which to interpret the status value. Set to
to indicate the system default.
A pointer the function uses to return a context that is currently always set to zero.
A buffer the function fills with the human readable string corresponding to the status code. Release this buffer with a call to
when you are done with it.
A status code set to
on success. See
for a complete enumeration of status outputs.

abstract.text: Returns an error object based on GSS-API major and minor status codes.
A flag that indicates the named status code comes from a GSS-API call.
A flag that indicates the status code comes from a call to an underlying mechanism, such as Kerberos.
Evaluate return values that most GSS-API functions use to indicate the outcome of an operation.
A pointer to the OID descriptor that exchanges object identifiers with many GSS-API functions.
A pointer to a buffer descriptor that you use to exchange octet streams with many GSS-API functions.
Returns a human readable string for a status code.
Frees the memory associated with a single buffer descriptor.
A pointer to a status result.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
